sen.e: Hirata no sho was a manor located in old Yamato Province.

sen.j: 大和一の大きさを誇った、葛下郡・広瀬郡に亘る散在性荘園。
sen.e: It was a scattered manor from Katsuge-gun to Hirose-gun, which was the biggest in Yamato.
sen.cmt: 葛下郡「かつらぎのしもごおり」とも読むようです。広瀬郡「ひろせのこおり」とも読むようです。
sen.e: It was the biggest manor in Yamato, scattered from Katsuge County to Hirose County.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more naturally; changed "-gun" to "County"
sen.e: It was the biggest manor in Yamato, scattered from Katsuge County to Hirose County.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 現在の大和高田市、葛城市、北葛城郡 広陵町、等域に及ぶ。
sen.e: It ranged the present Yamatotakada City to Katsuragi City, Koryo-cho, Kita-Katsuragi County.
sen.cmt: 「等域」は「等、広域」の間違いではないかと思うのですが修正せず訳出。「郡」はwardでなくcountyとしました。
sen.e: It ranged from the present Yamatotakada City to Katsuragi City, Koryo-cho, Kita-Katsuragi County.
sen.cmt: added "from" before "the present"
sen.e: It ranged from the present Yamatotakada City to Katsuragi City, Koryo-cho, Kita-Katsuragi County.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 平安時代は雑役免荘で、摂関家領。
sen.e: In the Heian Period, it was zoyakumen (exception from all levies except the regular land tax) sho, and the estate of Sekkan-ke (family which produced regents).
sen.cmt: 雑役免はzoyakumenのようです。
sen.e: During the Heian Period, the manor was a zoyakumen (land that was excepted from all levies except the regular land tax), and the estate of a Sekkan-ke (family which produced regents).
sen.cmt: changed "In" to "During"; changed "sho" to "manor" and moved it to earlier in the sentence; fixed grammar
sen.e: During the Heian period, the manor was a zoyakumen (land that was excepted from all levies except the regular land tax), and the estate of a Sekkan-ke (family which produced regents and advisers).
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更、Sekkan-keの補足を一部修正

sen.j: 鎌倉時代以降は近衛家領。
sen.e: In the Kamakura Period, it was the estate of the Konoe family.

sen.cmt: changed "In" to "During"

sen.j: 春日大社が領家で、興福寺 一乗院が知行。
sen.e: Kasuga-taisha Shrine was the ryoke (a lord of the manor), and Kofuku-ji Temple Ichijo-in was in charge of chigyo (enfeoffment).
Kasuga-taisha Shrine was the ryoke (lord of the manor), and Kofuku-ji Temple Ichijo-in was in charge of the chigyo (fief).

sen.e: Kasuga-taisha Shrine was the ryoke (lord of the manor), and Kofuku-ji Temple Ichijo-in was in charge of the chigyo (fief).

sen.j: 室町時代には、2,200余町（大乗院寺社雑事記）あったという。

sen.j: 大和武士である平田党（当麻氏、布施氏、岡氏、万歳氏 等：当麻氏・布施氏は争いながら共に高田氏とも称した）の母体となった。
sen.e: It became the nucleus of the Hirata clique (including the Taima clan, the Fuse clan, the Oka clan, the Manzai clan: both the Toma clan and the Fuse clan also called themselves the Takada clan while fighting) of Yamato bushi (samurai of Yamato Province).
sen.cmt: 下の行と結合、下のセル削除。
sen.e: It became the heartland of the Hirata clique (including the Taima, Fuse, Oka, and Manzai clans; while they were in conflict, both the Toma and Fuse clans also called themselves the Takada clan) of Yamato bushi (samurai of Yamato Province).

sen.j: 平田党は、春日若宮おん祭（おん祭）で流鏑馬等重要な儀式を受け持った。
